answers.answer: With geriatric cases you have to consider all past history (diabetes and pancreatitis) and look at current status.  A complete physical exam plus some current status blood work would be a great idea right now.  Diabetes control varies with age and pancreatitis recurs.  Get to the vet for a physical assessment.  Good luck, caring for a senior is hard - but special.

Thank you, I did take him to the Vet.  Had blood and urine workup. Blood workup was good. Urine showed high ketones - (probably why he is losing so much fat (3 lbs since October.) fat that he has lost maybe in the last month.The Vet thinks there might be an infection (one lab was very high - and it is only high when the sugars are high, but his sugar were good, so far she doesn't know what is going on.   I had to leave him overnight (he needed to be hydrated) and if he shows interest in food tomorrow and eats we might be okay.  If not, he'll have to stay Saturday and Sunday night, he doesn't like to stay there, he has been there before when he had pancreatitis and the relapse, but he wasn't acting like when he had pancreatitis; I did ask her if perhaps his teeth might have something to do with it, she said possibly.  So I came home without him.  I will let you know how we come out.  Again thank you.
No dog likes to spend the night or weekend in the hospital (I'm the same way!!), but sounds like you are in good hands and please keep us posted on the outcome.

I went to see Mr Fox, the Vet said I could bring home for the weekend but we have to be back by 0830.  He was well hydrated and alert.  Xrays were take today, a quick glance did not "pop up" anything wrong with the heart or stomach.  But the xrays have not really been read.  He would not eat there and had ot had insulin.  So I got to bring him home.  We'll see how he does the weekend.  He still has the iv in just in case he needs to stay Monday.  What other foods can I try on him.  He finally ate a bit of scrambled egg with a few pieces of ham.  Thank you.

question: My dog is not eating, hasn't for about 1 l/2 weeks, had bloody stools (mucosy) abut 3 times two weeks ago; drinks water once in a while; I cooked chicken and gave him chicken broth with a medicine dropper -5ml); also water with a dropper and now is very weak and unsteady on feet.  Still goes out to pee maybe 3 times a dayI don't know what to do for him any more.  I found him about 9 1/2 years, and my niece a Vet Tech said he was about 2 - 2 1/2 years old at that time - making him about 11 1/2 to 12 yo old.Past pancreatitis with a relapse(1 1/2 yo ago), then diabetic - on 4 units of insulin 2x a day; had cataracts - had eye surgery because he lost his sight (sees great), still using eye drops for that surgery.
title: Shaky hind legs, not eating, drinking, sleeps most of the day WHY
